An offside offence in soccer is when a player is positioned in the opponents' half of the field ahead of the ball and closer to the goal than both the ball and the second-to-last opponent!
How many players can a team have at the start of a soccer match?
A team can start with a maximum of eleven players!
How many goals can a player score in a single match in the English Premier League?
A player can score a maximum of 4 goals in a single match in the Premier League!
Who is the most successful team in the history of Major League Soccer?
Los Angeles Galaxy!
What is the maximum utilization of substitutions allowed in an international soccer match?
Three substitutions are allowed!
What is the purpose of the offside rule in soccer?
The offside rule is designed to prevent a team from having an unfair advantage in attacking situations!
How many players on a team are allowed to be in the penalty box when a penalty kick takes place?
Just the goalie and the kicker!
How often do the FIFA World Cup and UEFA European Championship tournaments occur?
Every four years!
What is the penalty for intentionally handballing the ball in soccer?
It is a direct red card!
What are the official rules for a penalty shoot-out in soccer?
The teams take turns taking five alternating penalty shots!
What is the name of the longest running soccer tournament in Europe?
The UEFA Champions League!
What is the penalty for an illegal throw-in in soccer?
A free kick for the opposing team!
How long do soccer matches usually last?
Soccer matches usually last 90 minutes!
What country hosted the most FIFA World Cup tournaments?
Brazil has hosted the most FIFA World Cup tournaments, with a total of five tournaments!
What is a bicycle kick in soccer?
A bicycle kick is a kick made when a player throws himself backwards to hit the ball with their heel into the goal!
What is the most common way of scoring a goal in soccer?
By kicking the ball into the net!
How is the goal-line technology used for in soccer?
Goal-line technology is used to indicate when the ball has fully crossed the goal line and a goal should be awarded!
What was the first season of the English Premier League?
The first season of the Premier League was 1992-93!
What year was the UEFA Champions League established?
The UEFA Champions League was established in 1955!
How often does the UEFA Champions League take place?
The UEFA Champions League takes place annually!
What is the longest soccer match on record?
The longest match ever played was an FA Cup tie between Stockport County and Doncaster Rovers, lasting 14 hours and 14 minutes!
What is the difference between a controlled and uncontrolled pass in soccer?
A controlled pass is when the player has complete control of the ball, while an uncontrolled pass is when the player does not have full control over the ball!
What is the most common type of throw-in in soccer?
The most common type is the over-the-shoulder throw-in!
What kind of throw-in style is quickest to take?
The two-handed overhead throw is the quickest throw-in style!
What is the three-second rule in soccer?
The three-second rule is a penalty for taking too long to restart play!
What are the international laws of soccer?
The Laws of the Game are the official rules of soccer!
